text.__SUMMARY__: Leptotyphlops telloi, also known as Tello's threadsnake or Tello's worm snake, is a species of African snake in the family Leptotyphlopidae.
text.Etymology: The specific name, telloi, is in honor of Mozambican herpetologist José Luis Pessoa Lobão Tello.
text.Geographic range: L. telloi is endemic to Mozambique, and adjacent Swaziland.
text.Description: A small species, L. telloi may grow to a maximum snout-vent length (SVL) of only 16.5 cm (6.5 in). It is solid black, except for white patches on the head.
text.Habitat: The preferred habitat of L. telloi is thornveld.
text.Further reading: Broadley DG, Watson G (1976). "A Revision of the Worm Snakes of South-eastern Africa (Serpentes: Leptotyphlopidae)". Occasional Papers of the National Museums and Monuments of Rhodesia, Series B, Natural Sciences, Bulawayo 8: 465-510. (Leptotyphlops telloi, new species, p. 500).
